a5d89661-41a4-41cc-bb51-978430a43eae.name: Damage Resistance (Tough Skin)
a5d89661-41a4-41cc-bb51-978430a43eae.notes: Tough Skin (-40%, doesn't protect against touch or scratches)

features.situation: to skill for others to cast a spell on you

729da659-d04d-47c3-9ae2-9eee722761ba.name: Berserk
729da659-d04d-47c3-9ae2-9eee722761ba.notes: Make a self-control roll any time you suffer damage over 1/4 your HP in the space of one second, and whenever you witness equivalent harm to a loved one

be525d6c-0d96-4f85-b24c-60eef18bfcb3.name: Bloodlust
be525d6c-0d96-4f85-b24c-60eef18bfcb3.notes: You must make a self-control roll whenever you need to accept a surrender, evade a sentry, take a prisoner, etc.

features.situation: from victims of your intolerance (may be as much as -5, at GM's discretion)

a2b16cc1-6529-442d-9f1b-9ed380dee4c3.text: Minotaurs are monstrous creatures with the heads of bulls and the bodies of massive humans (figure Minotaur height normally for ST, then add 3’’; weight is normal for their height). The fur on their heads is usually red or black, and matted. The rest of their bodies are exceptionally hairy. Their eyes are red and their skin is that of a swarthy Caucasian. Females also have the heads of bulls, though their lower bodies are those of stocky human women.

873a8dd7-0a4e-4158-883f-3649aac59e38.text: Minotaurs seldom wear armor, but prefer to wear some sort of clothing, even if it’s only a loin-cloth or untanned animal skin.

fe122aed-fec3-42b3-8131-cd03aa187aec.text: A pregnant or nursing female Minotaur will not have the Berserk or Odious Racial Habit disadvantages, but will have at least two dependents, of varying point cost depending on the age of the young.
